text: Raorchestes archeos is a species of frog. It only lives in a place in India, Elivalmalai Massif in the Western Ghat mountains. Scientists have seen it about 1524 meters above sea level. People have seen this frog in grasses near forest and in forest near grasses. Scientists say this frog is in much danger of dying out because it lives in such a small place, only ten square kilometers, and human beings are still changing that place, especially to make large coffee farms. ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Raorchestes aureus
